revised_title: Asymptotic Solutions for Hyperbolic Systems in Mathematics
tldr: The authors develop a theory for deriving formal asymptotic solutions for initial boundary-value problems involving hyperbolic equations. They use a method that considers a formal asymptotic solution of the form and apply it to equations with matrix functions of and an -component vector. The method involves solving first-order partial differential equations, linear systems of ordinary differential equations, and transport equations along space-time curves called rays. This research has applications in various fields, including electromagnetism and plasma physics.
